Pengurus NasDem se-Bengkulu Dukung Surya Paloh Kembali Jadi Ketua Umum
06 Nov 2019, 18:54 by Roki EP


Pengurus NasDem se-Bengkulu Dukung Surya Paloh Kembali Jadi Ketua Umum

KBRN, Bengkulu : Menjelang Kongres kedua sekaligus peringatan Hari Ulang Tahun (HUT)ke VIII Partai Nasional Demokrat (NasDem) yang akan dilaksanakan dari tanggal 8sampai 11 November 2019 ini di Jakarta, pengurus Partai Nasdem se Provinsi Bengkulu sepakat untuk meminta Surya Paloh kembali memimpin dan menjadi Ketua Umum Partai NasDem.
"Kita semua di Bengkulu telah sepakatnyatakanSurya Paloh agar kembali menjadi Ketua Umum," kata Ketua DPW Partai NasDem Provinsi Bengkulu Ferry Ramli, ketika dihubungi wartawan.
Dikatakan Ferry, alasan pihaknya sepakat kembali meminta Surya Paloh memimpin partai ini, karena tidak terlepas dari berkat kepemimpinannya yang telahberhasil menjadikanNasdem sebagai partai yang besar dan disegani dinegeri ini.
"Berkat kepemimpinan beliau (Surya Paloh,red) NasDem berhasil menjadi partai yang besar dan disegani di Indonesia. Bahkan kita di Provinsi Bengkulu juga mampu menunjukkan eksistensi dengan raihan 41 kursi DPRD tingkat 1 dan tingkat 2, serta mendapatkan unsur pimpinan Waka III DPRD Provinsi periode tahun 2019-2024," ujar Bupati Bengkulu Tengahini.
Ditegaskan, dukungan yang diberikan terhadap Surya Paloh ini tidak hanya dari Bengkulusaja, melainkan seluruh pengurus Nasdem dari daerah lainnya juga sepakat kembali meminta Surya Paloh kembali menjadi Ketum.
"Kita lihat dukungan dari daerah provinsi lainnya, sama meminta agar Surya Paloh kembali menjadi Ketum Nasdem. Harapan kita kedepan dibawah arahannya, Nasdem dapat menjadi partai terbesar di Indonesia," terangnya.
Senada dengan itu Sekretaris DPW Partai Nasdem Provinsi Bengkulu Erna Sari Dewi menambahkan, dengan sosok Surya Paloh yang sangat menginspiratif bagi seluruh kader NasDem.
Bahkan dengan pengalamannya sebagai seorang politisi, sosoknyayang sangat pantas untuk kembali memimpin Nasdem.
“Kita dukung penuh Surya Paloh mengomandoi partai ini kedepannya,” tutup Erna.

NasDem Management in Bengkulu Supports Surya Paloh Back to Become General Chairperson
Nov 6, 2019, 18:54 by Roki EP


NasDem Management in Bengkulu Supports Surya Paloh Back to Become General Chairperson

KBRN, Bengkulu: Ahead of the second Congress at the same time commemorating the VIII Anniversary (NasDem) which will be held from 8 to 11 November 2019 in Jakarta, administrators of the Nasdem Party throughout Bengkulu Province agreed to ask Surya Paloh to lead again and became Chairperson of the NasDem Party.
"All of us in Bengkulu have agreed that Surya Paloh should return to being Chairperson," said Bengkulu Province NasDem DPW Chairman Ferry Ramli, when contacted by reporters.
Ferry said, the reason for his agreement was to re-ask Surya Paloh to lead this party, because it could not be separated from the blessings of his leadership which had succeeded in making Nasdem a large and respected party in this country.
"Thanks to his leadership (Surya Paloh, red) NasDem succeeded in becoming a large and respected party in Indonesia. In fact, we in Bengkulu Province were also able to demonstrate their existence with the achievement of 41 seats in the DPRD level 1 and level 2, as well as getting the leadership element of the Waka III Provincial DPRD period in 2019-2024, "said the Regent of Bengkulu Tengahini.
He emphasized that the support given to Surya Paloh was not only from Bengkulusaja, but all Nasdem officials from other regions also agreed to ask Surya Paloh to return to become the Minister of Public Relation.
"We see support from other provinces, and the same request that Surya Paloh return to Ketum Nasdem. Hopefully in the future under his direction, Nasdem can become the largest party in Indonesia," he explained.
Similarly, Secretary of the Bengkulu Province Nasdem DPW Erna Sari Dewi added, with the figure of Surya Paloh who was very inspiring for all NasDem cadres.
Even with his experience as a politician, his figure was very appropriate to lead Nasdem back.
"We fully support Surya Paloh to command this party going forward," concluded Erna.
